alert.note: Alert for Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 1:44PM EDT until June 22 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Johnston, Sampson, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 140 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated one to two inches of rain fell from thunderstorms earlier this afternoon. Minor flooding is possible from the runoff, especially in southern and central Johnston Counties. - While the widespread heavy rain has exited the area, additional showers and storms will move across the area over the next hour with locally heavy rain. This additional rain will continue the risk of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldsboro, Smithfield, Clayton, Dunn, Angier, Benson, Fremont, Walnut Creek, Micro, Selma, Coats, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton, Lucama, and Stantonsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
